The Maritime combat systems team, part of the UK Ministry of Defence (“the Authority”) intends to amend the existing Sensors support optimisation contract (Nº MCS/1001) (“the Contract”) with Thales UK Limited (“Thales”) for the in-service support of sensor equipment including sonar systems, masts, periscopes, visual systems and electronic equipment fitted across the Royal Navy submarine and surface fleet, to include the provision of this in-service support to Astute Class submarines AH 4 and 5, specifically to the following equipment: UAA4, Astute visual systems, Sonar 2076 and Miscellaneous communications. Such in-service support includes additional manufacture and provision of equipment and spare parts, modification of equipment, repair and maintenance activity and ancillary design and safety certification services. The amendment will increase the previously published maximum value of the Contract by approximately 19 %.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The Maritime combat systems team, part of the UK Ministry of Defence (“the Authority”) intends to amend the existing Sensors support optimisation contract (Nº MCS/1001) (“the Contract”) with Thales UK Limited (“Thales”) for the in-service support of sensor equipment including sonar systems, masts, periscopes, visual systems and electronic equipment fitted across the Royal Navy submarine and surface fleet, to include the provision of this in-service support to Astute Class submarines AH 4 and 5, specifically to the following equipment: UAA4, Astute visual systems, Sonar 2076 and Miscellaneous communications (comprising Outfit 680 Emergency communication buoy, Interface cancelling equipment and the Own ships positions distribution unit). Such in-service support includes additional manufacture and provision of equipment and spare parts, modification of equipment, repair and maintenance activity and ancillary design and safety certification services. The amendment will increase the previously published maximum value of the Contract by approximately 19 %.

It is considered that this contract amendment can be placed with Thales by virtue of Articles 28(1)(e) and 28(4)(a) of Directive 2009/91/EC (Regulations 16(1)(a)(ii) and 16(1)(d)(i) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011 respectively) on additional services grounds and for technical reasons.

As the Design Authority, only Thales have the accumulated technical expertise and technical know-how at its disposal required to support this range of equipment. This includes the intimate knowledge and understanding of the existing equipment used across the fleet and to provide the necessary services and development of bespoke solutions to address availability issues. In particular, only Thales can provide certification of the safety and interoperability of the equipment to the reasonable satisfaction of the Authority.
Furthermore no other contractor other than Thales can reasonably provide the additional services and ancillary supplies as to do otherwise would create.
— incompatibility between the supply and support of such equipment used across the fleet and in particular on other Astute class submarines supported under the Contract (Astute Boats 1-3),
— disproportionate technical difficulties in the operation and maintenance of the equipment (again in particular in relation to Astute Boats 1-3 but also more generally),

— potential unacceptable interoperability risks between all such existing and new equipment both fleet-wide and in respect of all Astute Class submarines, and would cause significant inconvenience and substantial duplication of costs for the Authority.
Any increase in value to the original contract does not exceed 19 % of the value of the original contract.
